1 On 13 October 2008 I made final orders, except as to costs, which gave effect to reasons for judgment dated 12 September 2008: Australian Pesticides and Veterinary Medicines Authority v Administrative Appeals Tribunal [2008] FCA 1393. There was divided success in the proceedings.
2 These reasons concern the question of costs, as to which it was agreed that the Court should resolve this upon written submissions without the need for a further appearance.

citation.text: 15 Imtrade submits that costs should follow the event. The "event" it says can be considered as the commercial result, so that a successful litigant may recover all its costs where the objective sought by the litigation is achieved, even though the litigant does not succeed on every issue in the litigation: O'Keefe Nominees Pty Ltd v BP Australia Ltd, Trade Practices Commission (Intervener) [1995] FCA 1079 ; (1991) 128 ALR 718 per Spender J at 720, citing New South Wales Dairy Corporation v Murray-Goulburn Co-operative Co Ltd (1989) 14 IPR 75.
